result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation can transfer to Illinois if accepted. 
Defendant is on parole out of Illinois and may be discharging some time next year. If he discharges early from Illinois, he can apply for early termination of probation here.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
--------------------------------------

No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medication without a valid prescription and must be taken as prescribed.
--------------------------------------

Engage in any recommended counseling.
--------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Williams

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED

10:03 am  Court in session.  Cases called - 15CF390 & 17CF302;   
Appearances given:  
ADA Herrmann appears on behalf of the State;  
Deft Joseph A. Williams is present and appears with Atty Kira Visser.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing on 2 files  15CF390 and 17CF302.  Parties have an agreement.  
10:04 am  Court makes record.  Court did review PSI.  Court will adopt agreement.  
SENTENCE:  
Withheld sentence  3 years probation; If he is in compliance with probation and payment of all financials, he can request early discharge from probation.  PROBATION CAN TRANSFER TO ILLINOIS IF ACCEPTED.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges.  
2)  Engage in any recommended counseling.  
3)  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription and must be taken as prescribed.  
4)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
5)  Maintain full time employment. 
6)  No weapons.  
7)  Deft is on parole out of Illinois and may be discharging some time next year.  If he discharges early from Illinois, he can apply for early termination of probation here.  

8 days credit for file 15CF390;  10:06 AM  COURT IN RECESS.
Order For Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation report.

Defendant Joseph A Williams in court with attorney Kira Leigh Visser.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea count #1; count #2 & #3 DRI. PSI ordered. Matter set over for Sentencing. Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2019 at 10:00 am.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  No appearance by the Defendant; Atty Wilson was not able to appear today and will not be available to try this case next week.  Not known why Mr. Williams is not present in court.  He was present when these dates were scheduled.  Court will issue a warrant but stay it.  Court's Clerk will cotnact the SPD office to see if Attorney Wilson was SPD appointed.  Clerk will also contact Atty Steen to see if he has any information about this case.
Notice of Self-Imposed Disqualification

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Joseph A Williams in court with attorney Peter Wilson.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is scheduled for a Jury Trial on Monday and Tuesday of next week.  The parties have not reached any agreement.  One of the State's witnesses is not available for trial.  Atty Wilson is objecting to the trial being rescheduled.  Atty Herrmann notes that Atty Wilson had previously advised their office that he had no objection.  Court will schedule new FPT and JT dates.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
